might just act differently so we we don't realize what it's true functionality is ALS also very commonly

you know google.com first and say am I getting a page back from Google if I am

itself so we want to keep the malware running as as much as possible so we want to keep it going running as and

about the implementation um so layered service providers are this interesting thing in Windows um that basically
allows you to hook all windsock functionality so it was kind of done I'm
not sure the reason Microsoft did it probably for filters and proxies other things like that um but every time
anything that uses windsock makes a call it'll actually look through the installed LSP windsock service providers
and it will call them and and it will let them make any arbitrary changes to that met Network request um so it became
fairly common not super common but fairly common for malware to use this um not a lot of legitimate products used it
but malware can use it to sort of inject packets or manipulate packets or scan packets security products use it they
use it for filtering they use it for quality of service there's no reason we can't use it too and then we set up so
